# rsa-pop-quiz
**200 points**
## Description
> Class, take your seats! It's PRIME-time for a quiz... `nc 2019shell1.picoctf.com 2611`
## Hints
> [RSA info](https://simple.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_algorithm)
---
## Writeup
* Problem 1
```shell
Good morning class! It's me Ms. Adleman-Shamir-Rivest
Today we will be taking a pop quiz, so I hope you studied. Cramming just will not do!
You will need to tell me if each example is possible, given your extensive crypto knowledge.
Inputs and outputs are in decimal. No hex here!
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 60413
p : 76753
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
n
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):Y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
n: 4636878989
Outstanding move!!!
```
```python
>>> p = 60413
>>> q = 76753
>>> p*q
4636878989
```

* Problem 2
```shell
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
p : 54269
n : 5051846941
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
q
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):Y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
q: 93089
Outstanding move!!!
```
```python
>>> n = 5051846941
>>> p = 54269
>>> n/p
93089.0
```

* Problem 3
```shell
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
e : 3
n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
q
p
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):N
Outstanding move!!!
```

* Problem 4
```shell
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 66347
p : 12611
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
totient(n)
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):Y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
totient(n): 836623060
Outstanding move!!!
```
```python
>>> q = 66347
>>> p = 12611
>>> (q-1)*(p-1)
836623060
```

* Problem 5
```shell
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
plaintext : 6357294171489311547190987615544575133581967886499484091352661406414044440475205342882841236357665973431462491355089413710392273380203038793241564304774271529108729717
e : 3
n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
ciphertext
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):Y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
ciphertext: 
Outstanding move!!!
```
```python
>>> plaintext = 6357294171489311547190987615544575133581967886499484091352661406414044440475205342882841236357665973431462491355089413710392273380203038793241564304774271529108729717
>>> e = 3
>>> n = 
>>> pow(plaintext, e, n)

```

* Problem 7
```shell
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 
p : 
e : 65537
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
d
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):Y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
d: 
Outstanding move!!!
```
```python
>>> q = 
>>> p = 
>>> e = 65537
>>> from Crypto.Util.number import inverse
>>> phi = (p-1)*(q-1)
>>> inverse(e, phi)

```

* Problem 8
```shell
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
p : 
ciphertext : 
e : 65537
n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
plaintext
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):Y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
plaintext: 14311663942709674867122208214901970650496788151239520971623411712977119645236321549653782653
Outstanding move!!!


If you convert the last plaintext to a hex number, then ascii, you'll find what you need! 😉
```
```python
>>> p = 
>>> ciphertext = 
>>> e = 65537
>>> n = 
>>> q = n//p
>>> phi = (p-1)*(q-1)
>>> d = inverse(e, phi)
>>> pow(ciphertext, d, n)
14311663942709674867122208214901970650496788151239520971623411712977119645236321549653782653
>>> hex(14311663942709674867122208214901970650496788151239520971623411712977119645236321549653782653)
'0x7069636f4354467b7741385f74683474245f696c6c336147616c2e2e6f31633335353036307d'
>>> bytes.fromhex('7069636f4354467b7741385f74683474245f696c6c336147616c2e2e6f31633335353036307d').decode('utf-8')
'picoCTF{wA8_th4t$_ill3aGal..o1c355060}'
```

flag : picoCTF{wA8_th4t$_ill3aGal..o1c355060}
